summary: This code imports the "main" function from the "loop_till_target" module and sets the target duration of the video to 20 seconds. It uses a GIF file named "cute_cat_gif" as input, applies the main function to it, and saves the resulting video as "cute_cat_gif_20_secs_plus.gif". The code also checks if the final duration of the video is greater than or equal to the target duration using an assertion statement.

details.comment: This code imports the "main" function from the "loop_till_target" module and sets the target duration of the video to 20 seconds. It uses a GIF file named "cute_cat_gif" as input, applies the main function to it, and saves the resulting video as "cute_cat_gif_20_secs_plus.gif". The code also checks if the final duration of the video is greater than or equal to the target duration using an assertion statement.
details.content:
from loop_till_target import main
target_secs = 20
video_in = "/root/Desktop/works/pyjom/samples/video/cute_cat_gif.gif"
# no right codec! fuck. GIF not supported?
video_out = f"/root/Desktop/works/pyjom/samples/video/cute_cat_gif_{target_secs}_secs_plus.gif"
fvd = main(video_in, target_secs, f_out=video_out, in_place=False,debug=True)
assert fvd >= target_secs
